medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Severe abdominal pain began yesterday after consuming alcohol. The patient describes the pain as epigastric and radiating to the back, with a stabbing quality. Associated symptoms include nausea and vomiting, with the last episode of vomiting at 4 PM today. Last bowel movement was in the afternoon, normal with no blood. The patient does not usually drink alcohol, consuming it about every few months, but the quantity during these occasions is significant. There were no fevers or chills, and no chest pain or shortness of breath.
